Class SQLRemoteWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • SQLReadWriter
      • SQLRemoteWriter

  • public class SQLRemoteWriter
extends SQLReadWriter
    The SQLRemoteWriter Class extends the SQLReadWriter class, inheriting all the same methods, except that the connect method is instead designed for a remote, rather than a local, connection to a SQL database. This class is not used in our final project design, but was created as a fallback in the case that we could not get the java package running server-side. In theory, it could be combined with the SQLReadWriter class to generically read and write from SQL databases. Polymorphic combinations of these two classes would allow a mix of local and remote databases to be used.
    Since:
    2 May 2018
    Author:
    Aaron Wile, Chrissa LaPorte, Oriel Francis

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SQLRemoteWriter(int localPort, int remotePort, java.lang.String remoteHost, java.lang.String remoteIP, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String databaseName, java.lang.String databaseAddress)
      The SQLRemoteWriter constructor calls super to the SQLReadWriter constructor, and then additionally accepts arguments for the lPort, rPort, host, rHost, username, and password fields to use for SSH tunneling and port forwarding.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect()
      The connect method establishes a connection to the SQL Database on a remote server through SSH using port forwarding, based on the current databaseAddress field.

      • Methods inherited from class SQLReadWriter

        addArticleTopic, getMatches, readArticles, writeArticle

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SQLRemoteWriter

        public SQLRemoteWriter(int localPort,
                       int remotePort,
                       java.lang.String remoteHost,
                       java.lang.String remoteIP,
                       java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       java.lang.String databaseName,
                       java.lang.String databaseAddress)
        The SQLRemoteWriter constructor calls super to the SQLReadWriter constructor, and then additionally accepts arguments for the lPort, rPort, host, rHost, username, and password fields to use for SSH tunneling and port forwarding.
        Parameters:
        localPort - An int containing the local port number to use for SSH tunneling.
        remotePort - An int containing the remote port number to connect to.
        remoteHost - A String containing the name of the remote Host to connect to.
        remoteIP - A String containing the IP of the remote host to connect to.
        username - A String containing the username required to connect to the remote host.
        password - A String containing the password required to connect to the remote host.
        databaseName - A String containing the name of the SQL database
        databaseAddress - A String containing the address of the SQL database on the remote host.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect()
        The connect method establishes a connection to the SQL Database on a remote server through SSH using port forwarding, based on the current databaseAddress field. It overrides the SQLReadWriter class's connect method.
        Overrides:
        connect in class SQLReadWriter
